name: Path M Breast
title: Pathologic M
notes: **Note:** Involvement of supraclavicular (transverse cervical) lymph nodes is coded as regional lymph node involvement. See N (regional lymph nodes).
rows:
Unknown; distant metastasis not stated
Distant metastasis cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record
Isolated tumor cells found in bone marrow

No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis, BUT 
deposits of molecularly or microscopically detected tumor cells in circulating blood, bone marrow or other non-regional nodal tissue that are 0.2 millimeters (mm) or less in a patient without symptoms or signs of metastasis

Stated as M0(i+)

CLINICAL assessment only:

Distant lymph node(s):
    Cervical, NOS
    Contralateral/bilateral axillary and/or internal mammary
    Other than above

Distant lymph node(s), NOS

Further contiguous extension:
    Skin over:
        Axilla
        Contralateral (opposite) breast
        Sternum
        Upper abdomen

Metastasis:
    Adrenal (suprarenal) gland
    Bone, other than adjacent rib
    Contralateral (opposite) breast - if stated as metastatic
    Lung
    Ovary
    Satellite nodule(s) in skin other than primary breast

Carcinomatosis

Distant metastasis WITH or WITHOUT distant lymph nodes

Distant metastasis, NOS

Stated as M1

HISTOLOGICALLY confirmed:
Distant lymph node(s):
    Cervical, NOS
    Contralateral/bilateral axillary and/or internal mammary
    Other than above

Distant lymph node(s), NOS

Further contiguous extension:
    Skin over:
        Axilla
        Contralateral (opposite) breast
        Sternum
        Upper abdomen

Metastasis:
    Adrenal (suprarenal) gland
    Bone, other than adjacent rib
    Contralateral (opposite) breast - if stated as metastatic
    Lung
    Ovary
    Satellite nodule(s) in skin other than primary breast

Carcinomatosis

Distant metastasis WITH or WITHOUT distant lymph nodes

Distant metastasis, NOS
Pathologic M is not defined for the specific site/histology
No pathologic workup for T and N AND no clinical or pathologic evidence of metastasis
